org.jscripter.emu.java.lang
Interface Appendable

public interface Appendable

Internally represents objects to which char sequences and values can be appended, emulating a standard java.lang interface or class with the same simple name as this one.

This interface or class is only used internally by JS re-compiler implementations.

Please refer to the Java API Standards for detail description of the original class or interface.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must redirect the resolution of the emulated original Java class or interface to this one.

Method Summary
 Appendable append(char c)
          Appends the specified character.

          Appends the specified character sequence.
 Appendable append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end)
          Appends the specified character.
 

Method Detail

append

Appendable append(CharSequence csq)
                  throws java.io.IOException

Appends the specified character sequence.

Parameters:
csq - A character sequence to append.
Returns:
This object itself.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method.

append

Appendable append(CharSequence csq,
                  int start,
                  int end)
                  throws java.io.IOException

Appends the specified character.

Parameters:
csq - The character sequence from which a subsequence will be appended. If csq is null, then characters will be appended as if csq contained the four characters "null".
start - The index of the first character in the subsequence.
end - The index of the character following the last character in the subsequence.
Returns:
This object itself.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must report error on end-users directly using this method.
